intro: Cyphanthera odgersii, commonly known as the Darling River everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a low-growing habit with wiry stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Cyphanthera odgersii is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
